TopicTitle: Buzz Aldrin talks to space.com live 11 AM CST July 14,2014. Link below.

Articles.Content:
I could listen to a moon walker read his grocery list, so this should be good.

http://www.space.com/17933-nasa-television-webcasts-live-space-tv.html

Umm the articles' not very clear about how to view. Try this

https://plus.google.com/events/c6unfl6nhdmal3cm7luhck8lgsg

In 15 min. Wait for it..

Edited July 14, 2014 by Aethon
Thanks. I've got the page open and am waiting for it to start in about 15 minutes.

They were running a bit late but they've started now.

Edit: I'm sorry but he sounds a bit like Grandpa Simpson... Prattling on about hash tags, the internet and stuff.

Edited July 14, 2014 by PakledHostage
Well, he is old, but I don't like the condescending looks and talk from others. Give the guy a break...

Well, he is old, but I don't like the condescending looks and talk from others. Give the guy a break...

He did redeem himself quite well once he started talking about the things he knows. I've been watching to the extent that I can while I am supposed to be working. We're lucky that we still have this opportunity.

And I think the hosts are partly to blame when he doesn't come across well. A skilled interviewer would know how to spotlight Buzz in the best possible light (or the worst possible, depending on the interviewer's bias). The hosts here seem a bit amateurish though.
Yeah, he knows a lot. It's normal for conversation skills to reduce as one ages. He really knows what he's talking about, and I wish the hosts were more professional.
